org.jgapcustomised

Class BulkFitnessFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jgapcustomised.BulkFitnessFunction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AHNIFitnessFunction, DummyBulkFitnessFunction, RandomFitnessFunction, TargetFitnessFunction

    public abstract class BulkFitnessFunction
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Bulk fitness functions are used to determine how optimal a group of solutions are relative to each other. Bulk fitness functions can be useful (vs. normal fitness functions) when fitness of a particular solution cannot be easily computed in isolation, but instead is dependent upon the fitness of its fellow solutions that are also under consideration. This abstract class should be extended and the evaluate(List) method implemented to evaluate each of the Chromosomes given in an array and set their fitness values prior to returning.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • BulkFitnessFunction

        public BulkFitnessFunction()

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        public abstract void evaluate(java.util.List<Chromosome> subjects)
        Calculates and sets the fitness values on each of the given Chromosomes via their setFitnessValue() method. May also set the performance of a Chromosome if this is calculated independently of fitness.
        Parameters:
        subjects - Chromosome objects for which the fitness values must be computed and set.

      • endRun

        public abstract boolean endRun()
        Returns:
        Return true when an evolutionary run should be completed before the maximum number of generations is complete, false otherwise.

      • getObjectiveCount

        public int getObjectiveCount()
        Returns:
        Returns the number of objectives being employed. This is only valid for fitness functions and NaturalSelectors that handle multiple objectives. This default implementation returns 1. NOTE: the returned value should include the number of regular fitness objectives PLUS the number of novelty objectives (see getNoveltyObjectiveCount()).

      • getNoveltyObjectiveCount

        public int getNoveltyObjectiveCount()
        Returns:
        Returns the number of novelty objectives being employed. This is only valid for fitness functions that define novelty behaviours. This default implementation returns 0.

      • getObjectiveLabels

        public java.lang.String[] getObjectiveLabels()
        Returns:
        Labels for each objective defined by this fitness function, with regular fitness objectives followed by novelty objectives. This default implementation returns an array containing getObjectiveCount() strings constructed of the class name of the sub-class prefixed with either F# or N# where F denotes a regular fitness objective, N denotes a novelty objective and # is the index of the objective.

      • dispose

        public abstract void dispose()

      • evolutionFinished

        @Deprecated
public abstract void evolutionFinished(HyperNEATEvolver evolver)
        Deprecated. 

        Deprecated in favour of event listeners such as GeneticEventListener or AHNIEventListener.

        This method is called when an evolutionary run has finished. It can be used to perform testing or other analysis on the fittest and/or best performing Chromosomes evolved during the run.

        Parameters:
        evolver - Methods on this object can be used to obtain the fittest and best performing Chromosomes evolved during the run.
